models.course module

class Course(course_id: str, course_name: str, instructor: 'Instructor' | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Course domain entity.

Stores a course identifier, a human-readable name, an optional instructor, and a list of enrolled students. Relationships are kept as object references, while to_dict() exports lightweight ID lists for JSON.

Variables:

  • course_id (str) – Unique course identifier (e.g., “EECE431”)

  • course_name (str) – Descriptive course name (e.g., “Control Systems”)

  • instructor (Optional[Instructor]) – Assigned instructor, or None if unassigned

  • enrolled_students (list[Student]) – Students registered in this course

add_student(student: Student) → None[source]

Enroll a student in this course (no effect if already enrolled).

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll

to_dict() → dict[source]

Serialize the course to a JSON-ready dictionary.

Fields:

  • course_id (str)

  • course_name (str)

  • instructor (str or None): instructor ID if assigned

  • enrolled_students (list[str]): IDs of enrolled students

Returns:

JSON-ready mapping for this course

Return type:

dict
